reviews.review_msg: Decent prof. Quite unorganized and very vague instructions given with regards to assignments. However, she is very nice and is willing to help. Material is dry but she does a good job trying to engage students and make it interesting.

Have had MANY courses with Kina. She's one-in-a-million and it's unfortunate more profs aren't as demanding and rewarding. Always willing to help and give extra chances if you've proven you're making a sincere effort. She challenges, and her students are better for it!

An unorthodox teaching style to say the least. She is almost completely unresponsive to criticism or questions during lecture, but is also perfectly willing to give tons of help outside of class hours. At least for this class the instruction itself was fairly useless; she gave only 4 lectures, the rest of the course being one big group assignment.

She is disorganised, rude and arrogant. You have to be her buddy to receive good marks from her. Will bully you with questions and humiliate you in front of the class and laugh at your mistakes. Give feedback on all assignment the last day of class. We were allowed 7 minutes only to write her SFU evaluation before our final exams.

She is in fact a Poli Sci instructor and definitely not in the Criminology department. (or not that I'm aware of)  She is a very knowledgeable and very interesting instructor - this is my second class with her, and I have learned a lot.. and not just about poli sci!  Definitely take the time to go see her if you have questions.
